article:
'Solidarity' is the integration, and degree and type of integration, shown by a
society or group with people and their neighbors. Collins
Dictionary of Sociology, p621. It refers to the ties in a society that
bind people to one another. The term is generally employed in sociology and the
other social sciences.

What forms the basis of solidarity varies between societies. In simple societies
it may be mainly based around kinship and shared values. In more complex
societies there are various theories as to what contributes to a sense of social
solidarity.
